DataElement.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Adenocarcinoma AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Regional Lymph Node N Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for esophageal and esophagogastric junction adenocarcinoma based on evidence obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor with glandular differentiation arising predominantly from Barrett mucosa in the lower third of the esophagus.  Rare examples of esophageal adenocarcinoma deriving from ectopic gastric mucosa in the upper esophagus have also been reported.  Grossly, esophageal adenocarcinomas are similar to esophageal squamous cell carcinomas.  Microscopically, adenocarcinomas arising in the setting of Barrett esophagus are typically papillary and/or tubular.  The prognosis is poor._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor with glandular differentiation arising predominantly from Barrett mucosa in the lower third of the esophagus.  Rare examples of esophageal adenocarcinoma deriving from ectopic gastric mucosa in the upper esophagus have also been reported.  Grossly, esophageal adenocarcinomas are similar to esophageal squamous cell carcinomas.  Microscopically, adenocarcinomas arising in the setting of Barrett esophagus are typically papillary and/or tubular.  The prognosis is poor.

Concepts.definition: A malignant tumor with glandular differentiation arising predominantly from Barrett mucosa in the lower third of the esophagus.  Rare examples of esophageal adenocarcinoma deriving from ectopic gastric mucosa in the upper esophagus have also been reported.  Grossly, esophageal adenocarcinomas are similar to esophageal squamous cell carcinomas.  Microscopically, adenocarcinomas arising in the setting of Barrett esophagus are typically papillary and/or tubular.  The prognosis is poor.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10-4-18 Changed from Draft New to Released/tmt. 9-24-18 tt created for standardization.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 N Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to carcinomas including squamous cell carcinoma, adenocarcinoma, adenosquamous carcinoma, undifferentiated carcinoma, neuroendocrine cancers, and adenocarcinoma with neuroendocrine features. Sarcomas, nonepithelial cancers, and gastrointestinal stromal tumors are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with no metastasis to regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer with no metastasis to regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
